original: Jakobsson, Bengt Folke, civilingenjör, Göteborg, f. 5/1/16 i Gbg av ing. Charles J. o. Helfrid Jakobsson. G. 42 m. Margareta Eiding. Barn: Håkan f. 43, Staffan 45. — Stud:ex. v. Gbgs h. real 34, civ:ing:ex. v. CTH (maskinbj^ggn.) 37. Anst. v. SKF i Gbg 38, Åtvidabergs Industrier i Åtvidaberg 39-41, ilär. v. CTH o. Tekn. gym’n. i Gbg 41-431, beräkn :ing. v. Sv. Flygmotor A-B i Trollhättan avd. Gbg sed. 44. Skr.: Styrning av band-foTdon (dokt:avh. 47).
translated: Jakobsson, Bengt Folke, MSc in Engineering, Gothenburg, born on January 5, 1916 in Gothenburg to engineer Charles J. and Helfrid Jakobsson. Married in 1942 to Margareta Eiding. They have two children: Håkan, born in 1943, and Staffan, born in 1945. Bengt passed his high school exams at Gothenburg's Upper Secondary School in 1934, and received his Masters in Engineering from Chalmers University of Technology in 1937 with a focus on mechanical engineering. He was employed by SKF in Gothenburg in 1938, and then worked at Åtvidaberg Industries in Åtvidaberg from 1939 to 1941, before working as a teacher at Chalmers and Gothenburg's Technical High School from 1941 to 1943. From 1944 onwards, he was a design engineer for Swedish Aero Engines Ltd, Trollhättan division, located in Gothenburg. He wrote a dissertation titled "Steering of Tracked Vehicles" in 1947.

structured.name: Bengt Folke Jakobsson
structured.description: Bengt Folke Jakobsson was a Swedish engineer born on January 5, 1916 in Gothenburg. He passed his high school exams at Gothenburg's Upper Secondary School in 1934, and received his Masters in Engineering from Chalmers University of Technology in 1937 with a focus on mechanical engineering. He was employed by SKF in Gothenburg in 1938, and then worked at Åtvidaberg Industries in Åtvidaberg from 1939 to 1941, before working as a teacher at Chalmers and Gothenburg's Technical High School from 1941 to 1943. From 1944 onwards, he was a design engineer for Swedish Aero Engines Ltd, Trollhättan division, located in Gothenburg. He wrote a dissertation titled 'Steering of Tracked Vehicles' in 1947.
